units.title: Prepare EdU solution for labeling
units.text: 1 Make a 10 μM (1×) solution of EdU in both base medium and colon monolayer differentiation medium by diluting the 10 mM (1,000×) stock solution of EdU (component A of the kit).
units.rationale: This is an actionable step to prepare a reagent for cell proliferation labeling.

units.title: Apply EdU to monolayer
units.text: 2 Add 500 µl of the 1× EdU in base medium solution onto the apical side of the monolayer, and 1.5 ml of the 1× EdU in colon monolayer differentiation medium onto the basolateral side of the monolayer.
units.rationale: This step specifies precise volumes and sides for EdU application to assess proliferation.

units.title: Incubate EdU-labeled monolayer
units.text: 3 Return monolayers to the incubator (5% CO2, 37 °C), and incubate overnight (16 h).
units.rationale: This defines the incubation condition and duration for EdU incorporation into DNA.

units.title: Fix monolayer with paraformaldehyde
units.text: 4 Once incubation period is complete, remove the medium from both sides of the monolayer, and replace it with fixative solution (4% paraformaldehyde in DPBS−/−), with 500 µl on both the apical and basolateral sides of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 15 min.
units.rationale: This is a critical fixation step to preserve cellular structures for downstream analysis.

units.title: Permeabilize monolayer with Triton X-100
units.text: 6 Add 500 µl of the permeabilization solution (0.2% Triton X-100 in DPBS−/−) to both apical and basolateral sides of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 20 min.
units.rationale: This step enables antibody or dye access to intracellular targets by membrane permeabilization.

units.title: Prepare Click-iT reaction cocktail
units.text: 7 Prepare the Click-iT reaction cocktail containing 1× Click-iT reaction buffer, CuSO4, Alexa Fluor azide and reaction buffer additive, according to the manufacturer’s procedure.
units.rationale: This is a specific, actionable preparation step for fluorescent labeling of EdU-incorporated DNA.

units.title: Apply Click-iT reaction cocktail
units.text: 8 Aspirate permeabilization solution, and wash the monolayers at least twice with 3% BSA in DPBS−/−. Add 500 µl of the Click-iT reaction cocktail to the apical side of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 30 min.
units.rationale: This step executes the fluorescent labeling reaction to detect EdU in proliferating cells.

units.title: Seed organoids in Matrigel
units.text: 11 Resuspend the organoid pellet with 1.2 ml of Matrigel and seed 50 µl droplets into each well of an Olympus 24-well, tissue culture treated plate.
units.rationale: This is a precise, actionable step for initiating 3D organoid culture in a defined matrix.

units.title: Passage organoids by fragmentation
units.text: 29 Bend a 1,000 µl pipette tip by pressing down the pipette tip on the inside of the cap for the conical tube. Use this bent tip to pipette the Matrigel suspension 25 times if organoids are in the first passage after thawing. Otherwise pipette the Matrigel suspension 50 times.
units.rationale: This provides a detailed, reproducible mechanical dissociation protocol for organoid passaging.

units.title: Change organoid growth medium
units.text: 37 Carefully aspirate the medium from each of the wells using a vacuum aspirator and a sterile Pasteur pipette. When aspirating, tilt the plate toward yourself and press the pipette tip against the bottom of the well to avoid disrupting the Matrigel droplet adhered in the center of the well.
units.rationale: This describes a critical technique for medium exchange without disturbing organoid integrity.
